borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">The development failed to provide a Unilateral Undertaking or
s106 legal agreement, that would prevent the future occupiers from obtaining
parking permits in the local controlled parking zone for any additional vehicles
over the one provided on-site car parking space. The proposals could therefore
result in an unacceptable increase in on-street parking, impact on the same and
efficient operation of the adjacent public highway and fail to promote
sustainable methods of transport.</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"> As such, the
development is contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- National
Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policy T6 of the London Plan (March 2021); and<o:p></o:p></span></p><p>







</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policy BR15 of the Borough Wide
DPD (March 2011).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span><span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The development fails to
submit a </span><span style="font-size: 10pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Construction Logistics Management Plan that would provide
information and confirm that all vehicles can approach, pull into and out of
the designated loading area without blocking the highway and the service
road.&nbsp;A traffic management plan and further details of protection and
temporary arrangements for pedestrians, including access to neighbouring
properties would also be required within the plan<span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">. </span>As such, the development
is contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- National
Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policy T7 of the London Plan (March 2021); and<o:p></o:p></span></p><p>







</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policy DMSI 4 of the Draft
Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (December 2021).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span><span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The development fails to
provide the required number of waste and recycling bins, that would be
positioned in a convenient and appropriate location within the site. It was also
noted that the applicant has failed to submit a waste management strategy that
would show how the drop-off/collection of the bins will be arranged. </span><span style="font-size: 10pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">As such, the development is contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- National
Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policy BR15 of the Borough Wide
DPD (March 2011); and<o:p></o:p></span></p><p>







</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- LBBD Planning Advice Note on Waste and Recycling
Provisions in New and Refurbished Residential Developments (20 May 2021).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">The
development fails to provide the required number of cycle parking spaces that
comply with the London Cycling Design Standards. As such, the development is
contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy
Framework (DLUHC, July 2021);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policy T5 of the London Plan (March 2021);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">-&nbsp;Policy BR9 of the
Borough Wide DPD (March 2011); and<o:p></o:p></span></p><p>









</p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policy
DMT 3 of the Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (December 2021).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The only
access to the proposed development would be via a back lane which has no or
little street lighting and there is no dedicated pedestrian footway. </span><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The proposal therefore would
have a negative impact on road safety and is not considered a suitable entrance
to the proposed dwelling. As such, the development is
contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- National
Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policy BR9
of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011); and <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>







</p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policy DMT 1 of the Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version
(December 2021.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">The proposed
development by reason of its scale, siting and design would result in
overshadowing, overbearingness and a loss of privacy to neighbouring occupiers
at No. 169 Broad Street. This presents an unneighbourly arrangement and may
prejudice future development at this property. As such, the development is
contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy
Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, July 2021);&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy
(July 2010);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF)
Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policy DMD 1 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s
Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021);&nbsp;and<o:p></o:p></span></p><p>















</p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary
Planning Document (February 2012).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">The
proposed development by reason for its location, position and overall design would
fail to provide acceptable residential standard of internal and external
accommodation to the detriment to the living standards and amenities enjoyed by
future occupiers. As such, the development is contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- National
Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July
2021);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Core Strategy DPD (July 2010); and<o:p></o:p></span></p><p>









</p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policy DPD
(March 2011).<o:p></o:p></span></p>
description: Construction of a single storey rear building to contain 1 studio flat

constraints_details.result: Moon Pizza, 169 Broad Street, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM10 9HX
